clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Cap-assisted Water Exchange and Water Exchange in Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Trial Comparing Cap-assisted Water Exchange and Water Exchange in Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, randomize, controlled trial will compared cap-assisted water exchange with water exchange in patients undergoing sedated colonoscopy. Investigators test the hypothesis that that cap-assisted water exchange is more efficient and causes a shorter insertion time.

primary_outcome.time_frame: when the colonoscope reaches the cecum, an average of 14 minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The end of colonoscopy, an average of 14 minutes

secondary_outcome.description: when histology analysis of the removed polyps are available

arm_group.description: The air was turned off at the beginning of colonoscopy. Water was infused and suctioned at the same time during insertion. The air was turned on when the colonoscope reached the cecum.
Cap was mounted to the tip of the colonoscope when water exchange was performed.

intervention.description: a transparent cap was mounted to the tip of colonoscopy when water exchange was performed.
water was infused and suctioned at the same time during insertion of colonoscope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing fully sedated colonoscopy performed by the investigators
Exclusion Criteria:
- obstructive lesions of the colon
- massive ascites
- history of partial colectomy
- provide written informed consent
